attributes.action: I want To Make CPR Training Mandatory Taught in schools across my Nation
attributes.additional_details: CPR Saves Lives and minute without CPR reduces a person’s chance of survival by 7–10%Teaching it in schools means people in our communities will be able to act fast and make a life-saving difference before help arrives Young People Become Lifelong Heroes By learning CPR in school, Empowers Students, Builds Confidence CPR training teaches more than compressions  it teaches courage, responsibility, and the power to act under pressure. That’s real-world learning.
attributes.background: To run training in all school and all ages for CPR

rejection.details:
Education in Wales is a devolved policy area, meaning the Welsh Government has the authority to set its own curriculum policies.

Your petition is about something that the Welsh Government and Welsh Parliament is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it.

The Welsh Parliament has its own Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Welsh Parliament, you can find out more here: https://petitions.senedd.wales/

You may also wish to raise this issue with your local Members of the Senedd who represent you. You can find out who your Members of the Senedd are and how to contact them here: https://senedd.wales/find-a-member-of-the-senedd/
